title: NSW Police defend actions after videos emerge of violence at Sydney protests | ABC NEWS
description: 27 people have been arrested at pro-Palestinian protests in Sydney, as clashes between police and demonstrators turned violent during Israeli President Isaac Herzog’s visit to Australia. Footage shared on social media by Greens Senator David Shoebridge appears to show a protester being punched several times before being wrestled to the ground.  NSW Police Assistant Commissioner Peter McKenna has urged people not to perceive vision of the scuffles 'out of context.' title: Pastoralists hope Cyclone Mitchell will bring much-needed rain to inland WA | ABC NEWS
description: Tropical Cyclone Mitchell has crossed Western Australia’s northwest coast as a category one system. Most residents are breathing a sigh of relief with little in the way of significant damage, though warnings for flash flooding remain. title: Keir Starmer facing calls to resign over Esptein-Mandelson revelations  | ABC NEWS
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is facing mounting pressure to resign, including from the Scottish Labour Leader Anas Sarwar. Downing Street’s Chief of Staff Morgan McSweeney and communications chief Tim Allan have both stepped down following allegations Mandelson leaked confidential government information to Jeffrey Epstein. Meanwhile, King Charles was heckled and asked about his knowledge of the former prince Andrew’s relationship with Epstein, while Prince William and Princess Catherine expressed concern about revelations from the recently released documents. title: Chris Minns defends police actions at violent Sydney protest | ABC NEWS
description: In an interview with News Breakfast, NSW premier Chris Minns has defended police actions during a pro-Palestine protest in Sydney’s CBD, saying it ‘was a combustible situation that needed to be contained.’ Video has emerged of one officer punching a man repeatedly and another video appears to show police grabbing Muslim men who were praying. He urges people to 'not judge the full context of the interaction by a short clip.' He added that the interactions will be investigated.  Minns also stood by the Commonwealth decision to invite Israeli president Isaac Herzog to Australia. title: International community decries Jimmy Lai's jail sentence | ABC NEWS
description: The Australian government has joined the international condemnation of a 20-year jail sentence handed to pro-democracy campaigner Jimmy Lai in Hong Kong. His family say the sentence is effectively a life sentence, while the Chinese foreign ministry says Jimmy Lai deserves to be seriously punished for challenging the one country-two systems policy. title: Maxwell offers to speak fully' about Epstein files if pardoned by Trump | ABC NEWS
description: Ghislaine Maxwell, the partner of Jeffrey Esptein, has appeared before a US congressional committee to testify on the White House’s handling of files from an investigation into the late convicted sex trafficker.  Maxwell pleaded the Fifth Amendment right not to incriminate herself, but her lawyer says she is willing to speak ‘fully and honestly’ if US President Donald Trump grants her clemency.  Americas Editor John Lyons says a presidential pardon would risk outraging Trump’s MAGA base, which is already agitated by the administration’s delay in releasing more Epstein files. title: Jon Kudelka, cartoonist and 'national treasure', dies aged 53 | ABC NEWS
description: Award-winning Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka has died after being diagnosed with brain cancer in 2024.  Kudelka's work ranged from award-winning cartoons to paintings, prints and other art which featured his beloved Tasmanian wildlife. title: Milano-Cortina: Big chances missed but big momentum created
description: Australians Tess Coady and Mela Stalker both finished in the top 10 of the snowboard Big Air, but neither could crack into the medals. Both competitors have eyes on their favoured events later in the Games, so what confidence can they take out of this final? Plus, Australia have returned to an event for the first time since 2014.    Featured: Sami Kennedy, three time Winter Olympian and Stan Sport expert. Andrew McGarry, ABC SPORT.    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Investigation into Carnival cruise ship amid worker exploitation claims | ABC NEWS
description: Investigators from the Australian Maritime Safety Authority (AMSA) have boarded luxury cruise ship the Carnival Encounter, docked in Darwin. The Maritime Union of Australia says the investigation was sparked by reports from an anonymous crew member onboard. Shane Reside from the union says crews are earning as little as $2.50 and living in cramped conditions under the deck.
